meanings.definition: A person who lacks courage or is easily intimidated.
meanings.sent1: The playground bully always targeted the wimps who couldn't stand up for themselves.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a wimps when facing challenges; believe in yourself and stand tall.
meanings.sent3: The wimps in the scary movie were comically portrayed as running away from a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: In the face of danger, the wimps froze like statues, unable to move a muscle.
meanings.sent5: The wimps in the haunted house screamed at the sight of a harmless spider, much to everyone's amusement.

meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly or weak manner.
meanings.sent1: He wimps out of every difficult situation, never willing to face his fears.
meanings.sent2: Don't wimps when it comes to standing up for what you believe in; be strong and assertive.
meanings.sent3: She wimps every time she has to make a decision, always choosing the easiest path.
meanings.sent4: The team wimpsed their way through the game, showing no determination or spirit.
meanings.sent5: As the deadline approached, he wimpsed out of completing the project, leaving his team in a tough spot.
